StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI GO-ESP: Family Studies (Thoracic aortic aneurysms leading to acute aortic dissections)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS HLTH SCI CTR HOUSTON

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: “The authors wish to acknowledge the support of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI) and the contributions of the research institutions, study investigators, field staff and study participants in creating this resource for biomedical research. This research was supported in part by NIH R01 HL62594, NIH P50 HL083794-01, NIH UL1 RR024148 (CTSA), the Doris Duke Charitable Trust, and the Vivian Smith Foundation. We gratefully acknowledge the patients and their families who provided biological samples or data for this study and the many physicians worldwide who have referred families to this study. This study is part of the NHLBI Grand Opportunity Exome Sequencing Project (GO-ESP). Funding for GO-ESP was provided by NHLBI grants RC2 HL103010 (HeartGO), RC2 HL102923 (LungGO) and RC2 HL102924 (WHISP). The exome sequencing was performed through NHLBI grants RC2 HL102925 (BroadGO) and RC2 HL102926 (SeattleGO).”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: The informed consent document signed by the NHLBI GO-ESP: Family Studies - Thoracic aortic aneurysms leading to acute aortic dissections. Study participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. This consent group does require full or expedited IRB approval. Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
The informed consent document signed by the NHLBI GO-ESP Family: Thoracic aortic aneurysms leading to acute aortic dissections Study Participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. This consent group does require full or expedited IRB approval.
